The classic cup of coffee, easy to make and even easier to enjoy.
A brewing method not to be looked down upon, the pour over is an skill that every great barista should master.
A blend of espresso and chocolate make this drink an all year favorite for some.
When you just want a tasty cup of coffee without all the hassle a French Press might just be your best bet. Ease of use and a great cup of coffee each and every time.

array.name: instructions_coffee
array.item: Grind coffee if necessary and load into filter of selected coffee pot.
Add water to basin.
Press start.
Wait for brewing to complete.
Pour and enjoy!

array.name: instructions_french_press
array.item: Grind 1/2 cup of fresh coffee beans.
Boil water to 174 degrees fahrenheit.
Add coffee to beaker.
Add enough water to cover water.
Let coffee grounds bloom and enjoy the smell of the oxygen bursting.
Slowly fill beaker the rest of the way with water.
Allow brew to sit for four minutes.
Plunge press slowly!
Pour and enjoy your cup of coffee!

array.name: instructions_pour_over
array.item: Bring 20 ounces, or 600 grams, of water to a boil.
Grind 30 grams of coffee beans to a sea salt like coarseness. This ensures that the water does not simply flow through.
Place filter into your chosen dripper.
Wet the filter so as to prevent any filter taste making it\'s way into your coffee.
Add coffee grounds to filter.
Pour enough water over the grounds so as to get them all wet and allow them to bloom, puff up. This releases Co2 from the grounds and lets the oxygen burst.

Starting from the center of the grounds starting pouring slowly in a spiral formation. Careful not to pour too fast and aim for the dark spots of the grounds so you get all the flavor from the grounds.
Once your carafe or cup is full you\'re done! Enjoy your freshly made cup of coffee!

array.name: instructions_cold_brew_coffee
array.item: Grind one pound of coffee beans coarsely.
Pour grinds into a large mason jar.
Add four cups of water to your mason jar.
Cover, put in fridge, and let sit for 24 hours or longer, depending on desired strength.
After allotted time has passed, remove jar and get out a second jar.
Using cheese cloth or a fine mesh strainer, begin pouring coffee from one jar to another. Repeat this until all grounds are removed from coffee.
Once all grounds are strained out you\'re ready to pour and enjoy this summer time favorite!

array.name: instructions_aeropress
array.item: Bring your water to a boil. Aim for somewhere between 174 and 195 degree\'s fahrenheit.
Grind around 4 tablespoons of coffee beans a fine coarseness.
Assemble your Aeropress with a paper filter inside the cap.
Place over cup and drizzle some water over the filter to get it wet.
Place the funnel on top of the cup and pour in your coffee grounds.
Remove the funnel.
Pour water into Aeropress until it comes to the top.
Stir using provided paddle to ensure that all grounds are wet.
Insert plunger and press to extract coffee.
Taste and dilute if too potent.
